CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDTBT (alternating copolymer based on spirobifluorene, thiophene, and benzothiadiazole units)
2. PC71BM (phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester)
3. PC61BM (phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester)
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC61BM) - mentioned twice
5. [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester (PC71BM) - mentioned twice
6. conjugated polymers
7. electron donating conjugated polymers
8. electron accepting fullerene derivatives
9. 1,3-phenyl-3,3-diphenyl-2,2-bis(2-methylpropyl)-1,1-bis(4-phenyl[1,2-b]thiophene) (PSFDTBT) - mentioned twice
10. spirobifluorene
11. thiophene
12. benzothiadiazole
13. highest occupied molecular orbital (HOMO)
14. lowest unoccupied molecular orbital (LUMO)
15. main chain donor - acceptor alternating design
16. conjugated polymers (mentioned as a material class)
17. electron donating conjugated polymers (mentioned as a material class)
18. electron accepting fullerene derivatives (mentioned as a material class)

These are the Material Name entities identified in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PSFDTBT (alternating copolymer based on spirobifluorene, thiophene, and benzothiadiazole units)
2. PC71BM (phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester)
3. PC61BM (phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester)
4. conjugated polymers (mentioned as a material class)
5. electron donating conjugated polymers (mentioned as a material class)
6. electron accepting fullerene derivatives (mentioned as a material class)
7. thiophene
8. benzothiadiazole

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . Polymer solar cell devices based on the blend films of PSFDTBT and PC71BM show a high open - circuit voltage of 0.94 V and a power conversion efficiency of 4.6% without any post-treatment. All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

1. PSFDTBT (a new alternating copolymer based on spirobifluorene, thiophene, and benzothiadiazole units)
2. o-dichlorobenzene (solution used for spin-casting the PSFDTBT film)
3. PC71BM (electron accepting fullerene derivative used in blend films for high power conversion efficiency polymer solar cells)
4. [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester (another electron accepting fullerene derivative used in BHJ polymer solar cells)
5. HOMO (highest occupied molecular orbital) and LUMO (lowest unoccupied molecular orbital) energy levels
6. PCBM (short for PC61BM or [6,6]phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester)
7. BHJ (bulk heterojunction)
8. PCE (power conversion efficiency)
9. donor materials
10. solvent (implied, but not explicitly stated, in the context of the polymer being soluble in common organic solvents for solution processing)
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. PSFDTBT (optical band gap: 1.97 eV, HOMO energy level: -5.4 eV)
2. PC71BM (not explicitly stated as a property, but it is mentioned as an electron acceptor material)
3. HOMO energy level (-5.4 eV for PSFDTBT)
4. LUMO energy level (implied but not explicitly stated for PSFDTBT)
5. carrier mobility (7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1 for PSFDTBT)
6. on / off ratios (in the order of 10^5 for PSFDTBT-based devices)
7. power conversion efficiency (4.6% for PSFDTBT-PC71BM blend films)
8. open-circuit voltage (0.94 V for PSFDTBT-PC71BM blend films)

These are the properties of the materials mentioned in the paragraph.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| optical band gap of PSFDTBT |
| HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT |
| -5.4 eV (specific value for HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT) |
| hole mobility of pristine PSFDTBT film |
| on / off ratios of PSFDTBT-based devices |
| power conversion efficiency of PSFDTBT-PC71BM blend films |
| open-circuit voltage of PSFDTBT-PC71BM blend films |
| HOMO and LUMO energy levels for harvesting solar radiation |
| carrier mobility for generating and collecting free charge carriers |
| solubility in common organic solvents for solution processing (implied) |

Please identify the Values (number + unit) of material properties in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: A new alternating copolymer ( PSFDTBT ) based on spirobifluorene , thiophene , and benzothiadiazole units has been synthesized. PSFDTBT has an optical band gap of 1.97 eV with the low - lying HOMO energy level at -5.4 eV. The hole mobility of the pristine PSFDTBT film spin - cast from o-dichlorobenzene ( DCB ) solution is 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 with on / off ratios in the order of 10^5 . All the device measurements were performed in air without encapsulation. This is the first report on spirobifluorene - based conjugated polymers used for polymer solar cells , demonstrating the great potential of spirobifluorene moiety as an electron - donating unit for the construction of main chain donor - acceptor alternating conjugated polymers for high performance polymer solar cells . Polymer solar cells ( PSCs ) , as the most promising sustainable energy source alternative to inorganic - based solar cells , have received intensive attention in both academia and industry in recent years. 1 In comparison with inorganic solar cells , PSCs have the potential advantages of lightweight , flexibility , and manufacturing by low cost roll - to - roll process. 2 Up to date , bulk heterojunction ( BHJ ) structure , in which the active layer consists of an interpenetrating blend of electron donating conjugated polymers and electron accepting fullerene derivatives , is still the most useful active layer structure for high power conversion efficiency ( PCE ) polymer solar cells. 1,3 Intensive researches worldwide on polymer design and device fabrication have led to a rapid development in the field of PSCs. 1,4 Recently , power conversion efficiency higher than 7% for BHJ polymer solar cells has been achieved by several groups through the developing of new polymer donor materials with the use of [6,6]-phenyl-C 61 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC61BM ) or [6,6]phenyl-C 71 -butyric acid methyl ester ( PC71BM ) as electron acceptors. 4a-i For the designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers , the following three points should be considered : 5 ( 1 ) the polymer should have appropriate highest occupied molecular orbital ( HOMO ) and lowest unoccupied molecular orbital ( LUMO ) energy levels for harvesting as more photons as possible from solar radiation ; 5b ( 2 ) the polymer / PCBM blend films should have high and balanced carrier mobility for generating more free charge carriers and efficiently collecting them at corresponding electrodes ; 6 ( 3 ) the polymer should be soluble in common organic solvent for solution processing. 7 Main chain donor - acceptor alternating design is a very efficient way to engineer the band gap of conjugated polymers through the internal charge transfer from donor to acceptor unit.

Let's think step by step.

1. Optical band gap of PSFDTBT: 1.97 eV
2. HOMO energy level of PSFDTBT: -5.4 eV
3. Hole mobility of PSFDTBT: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
4. Open-circuit voltage of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend films: 0.94 V
5. Power conversion efficiency of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend films: 4.6%
6. HOMO energy level of donor polymers (unspecified): Appropriate value for harvesting maximum photons from solar radiation
7. LUMO energy level of donor polymers (unspecified): Appropriate value for effective charge transfer with acceptors
8. Carrier mobility of donor polymers/PCBM blend films: High and balanced values for efficient charge carrier generation and collection
9. Solubility of donor polymers: Soluble in common organic solvents for solution processing.

Note: The values for HOMO and LUMO energy levels of donor polymers are not explicitly stated in the text, but they are mentioned as important factors for designing high power conversion efficiency donor polymers.

3. Hole mobility of PSFDTBT: 7.26 × 10^-3 cm^2 V^-1 s^-1
4. Power conversion efficiency of PSFDTBT/PC71BM blend films: 4.6%
